intro: Lophiolepis hakkarica, commonly known as the Hakkaric sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Turkey and Syria. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically inconspicuous and not showy. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its leaves and stems. Lophiolepis hakkarica is often found in sandy or rocky soils, thriving in areas with minimal rainfall.
